chinese: .猛拉；使猝然一动 D， 急推；急拉；蠢货；古怪的人
他猛地把笔从朋友手里拿开。
english: He jerked the pen away from his friend

chinese: n.利润，盈利；益处 v.得益，有益于
这个女孩靠卖掉这件裙子赚了一笔。
english: The girl made a profit by selling the dress

chinese: adj.直觉的，凭直觉获知的
他有一种直觉，剪断蓝色的线能够拆除炸弹。
english: He has an intuitive sense that he should cut the blue wire to disarm the bomb

chinese: n.少数民族 adj.构成少数的
这两位少数民族妇女穿着鲜艳的服饰。
english: The two ladies of an ethnic minority group wear colorful clothes

chinese: ad），暂时的，临时的
他用纸板箱给小猫做了一个临时住所。
english: He used the cardboard box to make a temporary shelter for the kitten

chinese: n. 小伙子
这群小伙子风格各异。
english: This group of lads all have a different style

chinese: V.危及，损害（也作jeopardise）
过度工作会危害你的健康。
n.就职典礼
新任国王正在他的就职典礼上宣誓。
english: The new king is taking an oath at his inauguration

chinese: V. 消除，减轻
舒服的按摩可以缓解你背部的疼痛。
english: A nice massage will relieve your back pain

chinese: ad）.辽阔的；巨大的
这片辽阔的沙漠看上去不可能穿越。
english: This vast desert looks impossible to pass

chinese: 区 沉迷于；放纵；满足
这个女人沉迷于吃太多甜食的罪恶快感中。
english: The woman indulges in her guilty pleasure by eating too many sweet snacks

chinese: n青少年；维鸟 ad）， 青少年的；幼稚
这群青少年在一起自拍。
english: This group of juveniles are taking a selfie together

chinese: adv. 公开地
他公开发表演讲来传播信息。
english: He delivered his speech publicly to spread the information

chinese: n.要求；必需品
如果你想去其他国家，护照是必然要求。
english: Having a passport is a requirement if you want to go to another country

chinese: n.司法部
司法系统以国家的名义解释和应用法律。
english: Judiciary systems interpret and apply the laws in the name of a state

chinese: n.可信度；合法性
他更喜欢从官方商店购买产品，以确保产品是
english: He prefers to buy products from the official store to ensure their legitimacy
